fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When adding a *User List* macro into a table that is numbered, it will break it all.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Add a table;
# Make it numbered;
# Add a *User List* macro and set a group on it. 

h3. Expected Results
The macro is added in the table and you keep editing your page

h3. Actual Results
Things get wild and the table format get all messed up.

Removing the numbered column fixes the table.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some comments are duplicated on a page
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page-level comment
 # See comment
 # Later, see same comment duplicated

h3. Actual Results

It might help to know that I was using my personal hotspot on the train when I originally added the comments.

I already deleted the duplicate comments but the originals can be seen at the bottom of this page: [https://hello.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~839848977/pages/582631455/Analytics+link+-+WIP+Iteration+3]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

h3. Steps to Reproduce

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Using arrow keys to navigate a code block in the new editor will jump out of the code block if there is no content above/below the block

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Make a code block
* Ensure there's no paragraph text before and/or after (e.g. code block is at very start of page, or there's an expand macro directly after)
* Type some lines of text in the code block
* Try to use up/down keys to navigate the code block body

h3. Expected Results
The cursor moves through the content in the code block normally

h3. Actual Results
The cursor jumps out of the code block to just before or just after

h3. Workaround
Ensure that there is at least a blank new line above and below the code block. But this only works if the code block is not inside an Expand macro.
fields.summary: Using arrow keys to navigate a code block in the new editor will jump out of the code block if there is no content above/below the block

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have a custom template that has placeholder macro, the new page based off the template cannot overwrite the placeholder. Clicking on the placeholder text makes the cursor appear for one blink then disappears. Pressing on keyboard does not help. Only happens on new editor (Fabric)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit/Create a new template. Try editing the retrospective template
 # Add placeholder macro to anywhere in the template
 # Create a new page off the template
 # Try to click on the placeholder text so you can overwrite it

h3. Expected Results
* Able to overwrite the placeholder text

h3. Actual Results
* Cursor disappears after clicking on the placeholder text

h3. Workaround

* Move your mouse after clicking on the placeholder text. It will make the cursor reappear
* Click and type very quickly (before cursor disappears)
fields.summary: Cannot overwrite textholder in pages created from templates with textholder macro

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
When clicking the eye icon > "Manage watchers", only the first twenty users are shown in the dialog. There is a "Load more" button at the bottom, though this load only the next twenty watchers.

With an environment that has 300+ watchers, it is very hard to check for existing watchers. Also, after adding a new watcher, user sometimes has to click "Load more" a dozen times to confirm if the user is really added.

h4. Suggested Solution
* Add a search bar that can search through unloaded watchers
* Add a button to load all watchers at once

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
On the legacy editor, it was possible to create a table with a specific size, let's say 3x5, 4x4, 6x3 and so on, by simply selecting the size at the toolbar.

On the new editor, every table is created on 3x3 size by default.

Bring back the old way to create tables, by selecting a custom size every time.

Create a 3x3 table and add/ remove rows and columns to result on the size you need.

fields.description:
When we are working with a Confluence space linked to a JIRA Service Desk project as a knowledge base, we can split our articles per custom categories we add in the JIRA project.

If we go to create a new KB article (page) from within the JIRA project, it redirects us to Confluence (which makes sense, right?). After creating this new article and publishing the page, we have to go back to the JIRA project and add this new article to the category we wish.

It would be life-changing to add a pop-up after hitting in the publish button for the new article that would allow us to add that new article to an existing or new category on JIRA. This would save us time besides being a cool feature to have with this amazing integration between the products! :D
fields.summary: Create a KB article directly associated to a JIRA KB Category

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 The new editing experience has received a recent update that allows us to copy the link from a heading in the published mode, which is great to work with them as anchors on different articles.

!https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/files/945107733/978213085/1/1570467413152/Confluence_LinkableHeading.gif|width=470,height=107!

This is helpful, of course, but in order to improve this feature, it would be great if we could copy the heading link from within the editing mode of the page - this way we could have it working as the old editing experience feature, the *Anchors* macro.

h3. Suggestion
* After inserting a header, the editor could open a toolbar right below the header our mouse cursor is placed on (similar to the one we have with the *Layouts*, for example) with the option to copy the link to that header;

*OR*

* After inserting the header, the editor's toolbar could provide us with an additional option to copy the header link our mouse cursor is placed on.
fields.summary: Copy linkable headings from also the editing mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the [Create from Template|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/create-from-template-macro-317196995.html] macro, if the space key entered in the parameters is '0', then the specified template is not used. Instead, you will see the generic Create Page screen.

As a result of this, the specified title will also not be used.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a space, set the space key to 0
 # Create a new page, and add the Create from Template macro. Choose any desired template.
 # Set the Space Key in parameters to the space you just created, 0.
 # Save page.
 # Try to create a page from the macro.

h3. Expected Results

Desired template should be used, along with any other parameters that were entered.
h3. Actual Results

Sent to Create Page dialogue.
h3. Workaround

No current workaround. The space key will need to be renamed following the [Copy Space|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confkb/how-to-copy-or-rename-a-space-in-confluence-169578.html] procedure.
h3. Notes

This only occurs when the space key is just the number '0'. It does not occur with the following circumstances:
 # Any other single digit
 # Any combination of numbers, including ones that start or end with 0
fields.summary: Create from Template macro does not use specified macro parameters when space key is set to '0'

h3. Issue Summary
Copying the description from a JIRA ticket (in the new issue view) brakes the content if you have quotation marks in the ticket's description and apply the *Code* formatting (*CMMD+Shift+M / CTRL+Shift+M*) on a piece of the content in the Confluence page.

It is easier to explain on a video:
 [^How to reproduce CONFCLOUD-68437.mp4]

The text format doesn't add additional quotation marks in the text.

*Notes*:

h3. Issue Summary

The "Next" button works the first time it is clicked. However after navigating backwards in the wizard or closing and reopening the modal the button will no longer do anything.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to Space Directory
 # Click "Create Space" button
 # Click "Next" button, the type of space does not matter
 # Click "Back" or close and re-open the Modal
 # The "Next" button is no longer useable

See attached .mov
h3. Expected Results

The "Next" button can be used again after navigating backwards in the create space wizard.
h3. Actual Results

The "Next" button can only be used once. It appears that no event is fired on click. There is no errors or warnings in the console after the second click. There is nothing sent in the network tab.

Reload the page and the button is usable again.

fields.description:

 # Prepare 2 different images with the same name (e.g. in different folders).
 # Create a Question
 # Answer to the Question and put the first image

In spite of the same image name images should be different and do not override each other in answer thread

The same image in an answer and a comment. 
h3. Workaround

Use different image names

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In Confluence, if the application is [integrated with Service Desk|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/link-a-confluence-space-to-your-service-desk/] or, [opened to the public|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/setting-up-public-access-934718729.html], if an URL of a restricted page is accessed by a customer or an anonymous user, it will redirect the user to the log-in screen, instead of just showing the restricted page information.

Although the only way to have such users accessing the URL is to have the direct link for it, this can impact on situations in which Confluence has a link to a restricted page in a public page and then, the customer/anonymous user will not be able to log-in, hence, possibly not knowing what to do next, or, even that the page was restricted.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # [Integrate Confluence with Service Desk|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-service-desk-cloud/docs/link-a-confluence-space-to-your-service-desk/] or, [open it to the public|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/setting-up-public-access-934718729.html]
 # Create a page accessible by such users and insert a page link on its body.
 # Save the page
 # Restrict the page used as a link in the body of the previous page.
 # Have one of the public/customers users tapping the link of the page.

h3. Expected Results

The accessed page should mention that it is a restricted page.
h3. Actual Results

A log-in screen is displayed for the user to access the content.
h3. Workaround

Use macros that retrieve the pages in a list (e.g. [Children display|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/children-display-macro-724765170.html] and [Content by label|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/content-by-label-macro-724765178.html]). Restricted pages will not appear for users without access, in the macro list.
fields.summary: Restricted page redirects customer/anonymous user to log-in screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Similar to [CONFCLOUD-66969|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-66969],  if the user restricts a page for groups with an uppercase letter, members of the group will not be able to find the page in the list of the Page Properties Report macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # As a *site-admin* of the application, make sure to create a new group that will be using uppercase letters through [https://site.atlassian.net/admin]. For example, "testiNG".
 # With the created group (and also, the *Application Access* granted for the same, if needed), make sure to add specific users to the same.
 # Add group restriction to a page with the above group. On this page, add a table inside the Page Properties macro.
 # Add a Page Properties Report macro to display a table of the page above and adjust the parameters to have the columns appearing.
 # Ask one of the group members to access the above page with the macro on it


h3. Expected Results
The person from the group should be able to view the content of thee Page Properties report macro

h3. Actual Results
The person from the group does not see the page in the Page Properties Report macro. This will affect all the child pages from the restricted parent page as well.

h3. Workaround

Add the user in restriction individually, or add the user to a lowercase group.
fields.summary: Restricted pages do not display in Page Properties Report macro

h3. Issue Summary
Clicking on a scroll bar in a move page / parent page list dismiss dropdown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Press create page

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Make sure to have a template in the old editor that contains a template variable;
# Create a page with this template.

h3. Expected Results

The new page is created and you start to edit your page based on the template.

h3. Actual Results

A template preview is shown in the new editor, showing the content broken.



h3. Workaround

* Even so, proceeding to create the page will load the editor in the old editor.
fields.summary: Template preview shows the new editor broken when the template is still on the old editing experience

fields.description:
In Confluence, when a user manually adjusts the size of the sidebar in order to see the content on it, the information gets stored in the only browser that the user has an active session. In two scenarios, this situation is not saved:

* When the user accessed Confluence from a different browser. Although the configuration is still saved on browser A, the browser B configuration does not follow the same from browser A. This causes the user to use different configurations between the browsers and need to manually adjust it.
* If the site data is cleared (cookies and caches, for example)

For users that clear the cached content when quitting Chrome, for example, every time that they access Confluence, it will be necessary to manually adjust the sidebar again.

h4.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to have such modification either saved/configured through the user profile or, have it stored/associated with the user itself, meaning that if the cache is cleared, or, Confluence is accessed from a different browser, this would be preserved.
fields.summary: Preserve user sidebar configuration for multiple sessions

fields.description:
It would be so helpful if there were a Columns option on the Children Display macro that allowed users to specify the number of columns into which to divide the sub-topics.

I know I'm not the only one with parent topics containing more than a dozen children, and a dozen is the maximum list length that humans can easily take in at a glance. Also, it looks odd to have a long list on the left and a very wide area of white space to the right.

The workaround suggested many years ago was to manually add links to each child topic. The very reason that we would like a columns option is that we are managing many topics, so the suggested workaround is not a viable option. Please reconsider adding this feature for 2020!
fields.summary: Children Display macro needs a COLUMNS option

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

I was not able to publish article in Confluence (on Hello). Article was created with old-style template

 

I think other customers may experience similar problem as well? I think there are 2 areas to address here
1) Ideally, localStorage should be used as little as possible, not to get over quota. Another way may be to delete most old keys and their data from localStorage (if it is feasible for this type of data)? 
2) even if this thing cannot be saved to localStorage, user should be still able to Publish article
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Fill in localStorage for confluence website with some clutter (example of code is here https://stackoverflow.com/a/46730251/1343917) 
 # Try to create and publish an article (click "Publish" button). I used old-style template for this, not sure if it matters.

h3. Expected Results

Article is saved 
h3. Actual Results

Article is not saved

The below exception is thrown in the browser console

```
Uncaught DOMException: Failed to execute 'setItem' on 'Storage': Setting the value of 'localStorage/atlassian.5adfcc8b424d6b2e29a06c61.frontend.editor.tinyMCE.just.published' exceeded the quota.
```
h3. Workaround

When I cleared localStorage - I was able to Publish the article.
fields.summary: Saving an article when localStorage is full does not work

fields.description:
At the time of this writing, the Page Tree search macro, and the Search Results macro use the old confluence search to accomplish getting their search results. The old search method does not treat underscores as word separators like the new search does, so search results are different between the two.

In the case of the Page Tree search macro, it seems that the new search does not support the "ancestorIds:" search term nor does it seem to have any similar filtering options.

I would like to propose that the search mechanism for these be macros be changed to use the new search if and when possible to ensure that search results are consistent between the macros and the normal application search.
fields.summary: Change the "Page Tree Search" and "Search Results" macros to use the new search

When trying to edit any space's overview (homepage), it will open on the new editor and will throw some errors.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# create a new space (the overview should be on the new editor)
# edit the overview page

h3. Expected Results
It should edit without problems

h3. Actual Results
It throws the following errors on the page:
{code:none}This page has failed to load

Retrying in 0 ...{code}
{code:none}This page has failed to load

Retrying in 1 ...{code}
{code:none}This page has failed to load

Our team has been notified. Wait a few minutes and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support.

Error details: Network error: Cannot convert a Symbol value to a string{code}

The following error is logged at the browser's console when the third error is shown on the page:
{code:none}bundle.esm.js:60 Uncaught (in promise) Error: Network error: Cannot convert a Symbol value to a string
    at new t (bundle.esm.js:60)
    at e.<anonymous> (bundle.esm.js:1184)
    at tslib.es6.js:99
    at Object.next (tslib.es6.js:80)
    at tslib.es6.js:73
    at new Promise (<anonymous>)
    at l (tslib.es6.js:69)
    at bundle.esm.js:1147
    at bundle.esm.js:1627
    at Array.forEach (<anonymous>){code}

h3. Workaround
Refreshing the page will reload the editor without issues
fields.summary: Error when editing overview pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a new meeting note and a meeting note parent page already exists, Confluence creates a new parent meeting note page and appends the text: (2)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new meeting note 

h3. Expected Results
A meeting note is created under Meeting Notes parent page

h3. Actual Results
A meeting note is instead created under a newly created Meeting Notes (2) parent page

h3. Notes


h3. Workaround
It looks like the current space already has a page named "Meeting Notes", which doesn't let Confluence to autogenerate the summary page for meeting notes created using template.

Possible workaround would be to rename existing meeting notes page and let Confluence add template-based meeting notes into the autogenerated one.
fields.summary: Confluence creates a new parent meeting note page and appends the text (2)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
 * Customer Reported that they are seeing links instead of cards when adding Jira Issues. The links don't get resolved to Jira Issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Not able to reproduce, from support end.
 * From the customer side:
 ** Edit a Confluence page
 ** Add Jira Issue URL

h3. Expected Results
 * Links get resolved as Jira Issue

h3. Actual Results
 * The URL stays the same.

Workaround
 * Add the links using Jira issue macro
fields.summary: Links are sometimes seen as links by one user and Smart Cards by another

fields.description:
When a Confluence Page is exported a .doc File is created.

This is an old-file Format which can include (Office) Makros. This is a security problem and .doc files are gonne be blocked more and more.

Please change the export format to .docx.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you copy an image from a Confluence page, it is not possible to paste it on another page or elsewhere, it pastes only a blank square instead. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Copy an image from any Confluence page
 # Paste it on any Confluence page in edit mode
# Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
Image is visible on edit mode and visible after publishing
h3. Actual Results
Only a small blank square is shown instead of the image in the clipboard

h3. Workaround
Open the attachment's page, open the image, copy it to the clipboard and then paste it where you  wish.
fields.summary: Copying an image from a Confluence page does not work

h3. Issue Summary

fields.description:
h3. Summary
* Currently there are just a few formatting options for tables in the new editor, and this can be somewhat limiting for some business, as they use Confluence's table to present their data neatly.

h3. Proposed Solution
* Include more customization options for tables, such as :
** Auto-size option for cells' height and width;
** Fixed cells (read-only)
** Responsive vs fixed width/height;
fields.summary: Provide more table formatting options in the new editor

h3. Actual Results
* Activity macro just occupies a portion of the page, as can be seen in these next screenshots

 !Screen Shot 2019-10-24 at 11.28.15.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* Workbox and email notifications are still triggered for notifications such as user mentions even though all notification emails are disabled in Confluence personal settings

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow a "silent mode" for either/both email and workbox notifications where zero notifications are delivered to a user while the feature is enabled
* The feature should also mute user mention notification emails

h3. Why this is important
* Some customers don't want any email traffic
* An extension of [CONFCLOUD-26672|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-26672] where emails can be disabled completely

h3. Workaround 
* None
fields.summary: Ability to "snooze" email and workbox notifications or go into a "silent mode" so users don't receive any notifications
